result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kelly L. Severson

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:48 AM Cases called: 22CF680 & 22CF869 Defendant Kelly L. Severson in court.  Attorney Jay E. Heit in court for Kelly L. Severson.  Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The parties are requesting more time to finalize the DAGP. 

Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in both felony files and Court accepts waiver. Cases referred to Br. 5 for scheduling.

9:37 AM Cases called: 22CF680 & 22CF869. Defendant Kelly Severson appeared in court with Attorney Jay Heit. Attorney Tiffany Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

22CF869: Waives reading of the Criminal Complaint. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. Defendant ordered to be fingerprinted. Bond is set. 

Both cases: Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 9/12/22 at 1:15pm
Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
